definition: measure of length, ten Chinese feet (3.3 m)/to measure/husband/polite appellation for an older male

sentences.english: Mothers-in-law hasten sons-in-law to buy houses, thus they may assure before their daughters getting married.
sentences.chinese: 丈母娘督促小女婿快点买房，这样才放心嫁女儿。

sentences.english: Mothers-in-law improve the rising housing price.
sentences.chinese: 丈母娘鞭促房价高歌猛进。

sentences.english: A few days later, the farmer's mother-in-law was killed when his mule kicked her.
sentences.chinese: 几天后，农夫的丈母娘被骡子踢到而伤重不治。

sentences.english: A mother-in-law on a honeymoon is a fifth wheel.
sentences.chinese: 度蜜月时，丈母娘是个大电灯泡。

sentences.english: It is usually husbands who crack the jokes about difficult, interfering mothers-in-law .
sentences.chinese: 女婿们常爱拿难缠多事的丈母娘开开玩笑。

sentences.english: One year, a particular harried husband decided to buy his mother-in-law a cemetery plot as a Christmas gift.
sentences.chinese: 有一年，非常忙碌的丈夫决定买一块寿地给丈母娘。

sentences.english: His mother-in-law offered to spend some time on his farm.
sentences.chinese: 他的丈母娘主动拨空到农场帮忙。

sentences.english: Then Mrs. Claus told Santa that her mother was coming to visit.
sentences.chinese: 就在这时，圣诞夫人告诉老头子，丈母娘要来。

sentences.english: Chinese mothers-in-law to-be, it seems, can be an unforgiving bunch.
sentences.chinese: 中国的准丈母娘们似乎是不饶人的一群。

sentences.english: Today, my mother-in-law stayed over at our house to watch over our newborn while I was at work.
sentences.chinese: 今天丈母娘来我们家住，帮我们照看刚出生的小宝宝。

sentences.english: Do you know the punishment for bigamy? Two mother -in-laws .
sentences.chinese: 知道重婚后最大的惩罚是什么吗？两个丈母娘。

definition: daughter-in-law/wife (of a younger man)/young married woman/young woman
erhua variant of 兒媳婦|儿媳妇[er2 xi2 fu5]
